communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (College Of Southern Maryland)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

title: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Department of State)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Department of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

For purposes of this request, "SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY" means any of: (a) Executive Order No. 1980-18 Amended, dated May 6, 2024, 54 Pa.B. 3018; (b) 4 Pa. Code §  7.158.1 ("Personal conduct," providing that "No employee, appointee or official of the Executive Branch of the Commonwealth may engage in scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute") or (c) any policy, guidance, regulation, or other prohibition against "scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute."

1. Any records reflecting a complaint, charge, or disciplinary action concerning any violation (or alleged violation) of a SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

2. Any records reflecting any warning issued to any employee concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

3. Any policy, guidance, regulation, or handbook concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

This request is limited to records generated on or after May 5, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Department of General Services)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Department of General Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

For purposes of this request, "SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY" means any of: (a) Executive Order No. 1980-18 Amended, dated May 6, 2024, 54 Pa.B. 3018; (b) 4 Pa. Code §  7.158.1 ("Personal conduct," providing that "No employee, appointee or official of the Executive Branch of the Commonwealth may engage in scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute") or (c) any policy, guidance, regulation, or other prohibition against "scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute."

1. Any records reflecting a complaint, charge, or disciplinary action concerning any violation (or alleged violation) of a SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

2. Any records reflecting any warning issued to any employee concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

3. Any policy, guidance, regulation, or handbook concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

This request is limited to records generated on or after May 5, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RTK 2025 - 007 interim response letter
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

On January 23, 2025, the open-records officer of the Department of General Services received your written request for records, which is attached and incorporated by reference as if fully set forth herein.


The Department of General Services is responding to your request under the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law, 65 P.S. § 67.101, et seq. (RTKL).  Under the RTKL, 65 P.S. § 67.901, a written response to your request is due within five business days, on or before January 30, 2025. This is an interim response, not a final response, to your request.  Pursuant to 65 P.S. § 67.902(a)-(b), you are hereby notified that your request is being reviewed for the reasons listed below, and the Department of General Services will require up to an additional 30 calendar days, i.e., until March 3, 2025, to respond to your request:

*       Compliance with your request may require the redaction of certain information that is not subject to access under the RTKL.

*       Your request is under legal review which is necessary to determine whether a requested record is subject to access under the RTKL.

*       The extent or nature of the request precludes a response within the five-business day time period.

Further, prior to granting a request for access in accordance with the RTKL, the Department of General Services may require a requester to prepay an estimate of the fees authorized under 65 P.S. § 67.1307(h) if the fees required to fulfill the request are expected to exceed $100. If prepayment is required, the amount owed will be reflected in our subsequent response.

If you have any questions regarding this letter, please contact me.

Thank you.


Cheryl Spackman | RTK Coordinator
PA Department of General Services
Office of Chief Counsel
North Office Building
401 North Street | Room 603
Harrisburg, PA 17120
Fax: 717.787.9138
www.dgs.state.pa.us<http://www.dgs.state.pa.us/>

DEPT MR 180170
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

title: Arizona Fusion Centers on Sex Work

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona Fusion Centers on Sex Work
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All threat assessments, field reports, intelligence updates, emails, and email attachments, which mention the following terms or names:

Prostitute
Escort
"Sex Work" or "Sex Worker"
"Sex trafficking" or "Sex Trafficker"
"Sex Buyer"
“Commercial sex” 
"Sex Trade" or "Sex Industry"
"Desiree Alliance"
"Cris Sardina"

This request has a date range of 1/1/2021 until the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Tara Burns

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Thank you for your support with this request. It has been 20 months since my request was created, originally submitted on May 29, 2023. I keep receiving the following email notification with no additional information: The Public Records Unit will let you know when the records are ready for invoice and release.

Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response. You had originally assigned it reference number #202309270169.

Please provide the records at your earliest convenience.

Thank You

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication:
Ms. Burns,

My staff is working diligently to fulfill the below request.  This request generated approximately 1,394 items which are currently being reviewed and redacted by our staff.  I have assigned two of my most experienced redactors to finalize the redactions for this document and we will provide invoice as soon as they have completed their review.

We apologize for the extended delay and thank you for your patience.



Thank you,
Stephen Skuba Jr #10329
Administrative Supervisor
[cid:image001.png@01DB71A5.D7C89170]
Arizona Department of Public Safety
Public Records Unit
P.O. Box 6638, MD 3240
Phoenix, AZ  85005

Phone: 602-223-2226
Fax: 602-223-2945
Website: https://www.azdps.gov/services/public-services-portal/records-request


"To facilitate records requests, protect personal information, and provide vital technology and operational support through exceptional customer service."

NOTICE: This e-mail and any attachments to it may contain information that is PRIVILEGED and CONFIDENTIAL under State and Federal law and is intended only for the use of the specific individual(s) to whom it is addressed. This information may only be used or disclosed in accordance with law, and you may be subject to penalties under law for improper use or further disclosure of the information in this e-mail and its attachments. If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the person named above by reply e-mail, and then delete the one you received.

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication: Thank you Mr. Skuba. Can you estimate when this might be done and about how much it will cost?

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication:
Ms. Burns,

I apologize for the delay in getting back to you.  My team is continuing to work diligently on preparing those email records for you, however I cannot give you a solid estimate on how much longer it will take.  My staff members have advised me that they are caught up to emails dated in July 2023.

The request is marked for electronic release, so our fee will be $9.  As this request was received by email, payment may be remitted via cashier’s check, money order, or business check once the records are available for release to PO Box 6638, MD 3240, Phoenix, AZ 85005.



Thank you,
Stephen Skuba Jr #10329
Administrative Supervisor

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication:
Thank you Mr. Skuba.

I sent the $9 through Muckrock last week. 

It has been 22 months now since I made my request. What is the status? Please send the documents.

Tara Burns

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #202309270169
communications.communication:
Ms. Burns,

My staff is continuing to work diligently on getting the records prepared for release.

I would like to offer you a rolling release of the records.  We will provide you the portions of your request that have been prepared and, as further portions become available, will provide those on a regular schedule.  If this suits your needs, we will provide what has been prepared so far.  Will a three-week frequency be acceptable?  There will be no additional charge for a rolling release.

Please let me know so we can begin providing what records we have prepared.



Thank you,
Stephen Skuba Jr #10329
Administrative Supervisor
[cid:image001.png@01DB8937.C0E6A830]

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Jaun Cardillo case log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to respectfully request a log detailing all cases handled by Senior Deputy Medical Examiner Juan Cardillo during his tenure at the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner’s office. The log should include the case numbers, decedent names, and the dates of birth for all decedents listed. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

Cassie Sipe

title: Request for Bodycam and Related Records – High-Speed Chase Ending at Alamo Quarry on Nov. 14, 2024

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam and Related Records – High-Speed Chase Ending at Alamo Quarry on Nov. 14, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any and all body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, police reports, dispatch audio, and supplemental documentation associated with the high-speed chase involving Marie Schneider that occurred on November 14, 2024. The incident began in Comal County and ended at the Alamo Quarry in San Antonio, Bexar County.

The Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) was involved in the pursuit. The subject, Marie Schneider (37), allegedly struck several vehicles and assaulted a State Trooper during the incident. She was arrested on-site and faces multiple charges including assault on a peace officer and driving while intoxicated.

If your agency possesses records from any involved Troopers, please include:

Body-worn camera footage from troopers at the scene

In-car dash camera video of the pursuit and/or arrest

911 call or dispatch audio referencing the pursuit or arrest

Arrest report, incident report, use of force report, or offense narrative

Any booking photos and charge summaries filed at the time of arrest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Information of March 28, 2025, Reference # P006440-032825 Dear Christopher Udeani, The Texas Department of Public Safety received a public records request from you on March 28, 2025. Your request mentioned: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting any and all body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, police reports, dispatch audio, and supplemental documentation associated with the high-speed chase involving Marie Schneider that occurred on November 14, 2024. The incident began in Comal County and ended at the Alamo Quarry in San Antonio, Bexar County. 

The Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) was involved in the pursuit. The subject, Marie Schneider (37), allegedly struck several vehicles and assaulted a State Trooper during the incident. She was arrested on-site and faces multiple charges including assault on a peace officer and driving while intoxicated. 

If your agency possesses records from any involved Troopers, please include: 

Body-worn camera footage from troopers at the scene 

In-car dash camera video of the pursuit and/or arrest 

911 call or dispatch audio referencing the pursuit or arrest 

Arrest report, incident report, use of force report, or offense narrative 

Any booking photos and charge summaries filed at the time of arrest 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Christopher Udeani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ftexas-department-public-safety-621%252Frequest-for-bodycam-and-related-records-high-speed-chase-ending-at-alamo-quarry-on-nov-14-2024-184043%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAeEakpjgMb8RP3SSTymZlOuV8%3A1ty3kc%3AtaZQhcfHC_83Bb4YcbHgUof_IKEOzYPDb9caEF6gzEQ The Attorney General’s Office previously ruled that the requested information is excepted from disclosure.  Please see Open Records Letter Ruling 2025-001472 attached to this message.  The status of the records and the law(s) at issue are unchanged from the date of the ruling; accordingly, DPS is continuing to withhold the requested information.  As per the attached decision, you are entitled to basic information for this matter. This basic information is attached to this message and is provided free of charge. The date of birth of any living person is excepted from required public disclosure under common-law privacy. Paxton v. City of Dallas, No. 03-13-00546-CV, 2015 Tex. App. LEXIS 5228, at *10 (Tex. App.—Austin May 22, 2015, pet. denied) (mem. op.)  The Department has received a previous determination from the Attorney General’s office allowing us to redact the dates of birth of living individuals from the records we are providing to you without requesting a ruling. Open Records Letter Ruling 2015-27249; see Gov’t Code§ 552.301(a); see also Open Records Decision No. 673 at 7 (2001). We have redacted the social security number of one or more living individuals excepted from disclosure by section 552.147 of the Government Code, as section 552.147(b) authorizes a governmental body to redact this information without the necessity of requesting a decision from the attorney general. The information you requested contains information that relates to: 
a motor vehicle operator’s or driver’s license or permit issued by an agency of this state or another state or country; or a motor vehicle title or registration issued by an agency of this state or another state or country; or a personal identification document issued by an agency of this state or another state or country or a local agency authorized to issue an identification document. 

This information is confidential under section 552.130 of the Texas Government Code.  Our office is prohibited by law from releasing this information to you, and therefore we have removed this information from the enclosed information we are providing to you. 

Normally, we must request a ruling from the Texas Attorney General before we can withhold any of the information you requested.  However, section 552.130 allows us to withhold this specific information without requesting a ruling from the attorney general. 

You have the right to appeal our decision to withhold this information from you. Instructions for appeal are at the end of this letter.  If you do not want to appeal, you do not need to do anything else.  Please note that we are only withholding the specific categories of information that are confidential under section 552.130.  We will process the rest of your request for information in accordance with the terms of the Public Information Act. How to Appeal the Withholding of Information Under 552.130 Without an AG Ruling Requested 

If you wish to appeal the withholding of information discussed on the previous page, you must send the following to the attorney general: 

(1) a signed, written statement indicating your wish to appeal the withholding of information; 
(2) the name of the governmental body that withheld information from you; 
(3) the date you made your original request for information; and 
(4) a copy of your original request for information, or if you are unable to provide a copy, a description of your original request for information. 

You may also submit written comments stating why you think the information should be released to you, but you are not required to do so. 

Send your appeal by mail to the attorney general at: 

Open Records Division 
PO Box 12548 
Austin, Texas 78711-2548 

Within forty-five business days after receiving all of the above-listed items necessary to file your appeal, the attorney general will issue a written ruling on the matter.  You will receive a copy of this ruling in the mail. 
For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Albert DiMarco 
OGC

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (University of Maine)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anne Marie Tamburro

Hello,

It looks like this request was going to an old email address, so we've redirected the request to this contact.

---

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Law Request: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (1977 N.Y. Laws ch. 933), I hereby request the following records:

We are Economics Professors in the College of Business at Ferris State University, and are engaged in an empirical research project on police behavior and citizen complaints. This project requires us to request data from your department. If you have questions about this request or suggestions, we would be happy to discuss them with you.

We have located the Rochester professional stands section of the annual report for 2011-2015. If you can send us that report for 2007-2010 and 2016-2017, then you can omit numbers #1 and #2 of our request. 

1. What is the total number of citizen complaints (allegations of misconduct) made against your department’s officers annually for the last 10 years? If your department logs complaints in a database, spreadsheet, or other log, a copy of those logs is fine instead.
Please include the type of complaint (i.e., use of force, abuse language, unwarranted search) and the result of complaint (i.e., sustained, exonerated).
2. What is the total number of complaints police officers made against their peer officers in department annually for the last 10 years? If your department logs complaints in a database, spreadsheet, or other log, a copy of those logs is fine instead.
Please include the type of complaint (i.e., use of force, abuse language, unwarranted search) and the result of complaint (i.e., sustained, exonerated).
3. What is the annual number of officers involved in shootings in your department for the past 10 years? Any documentation or reports that detail the annual number of officer-involved shootings in your department for the past 10 years would be sufficient.
Please include documentation regarding how many of these officer-involved shootings involved disciplinary action. (Please list officer firearm discharge directed at a person separately from a shooting involving an animal and separately from accidental firearm discharges).
Please include the number of officer-involved shootings resulting in discipline.
4. Which of the above data are published publicly? Please provide a link to any and all publicly available reports containing the data above.
Collecting this information is very important to our research, so we would like to emphasize, if you have questions about my request or suggestions, we would be happy to discuss them with you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Alexander Cartwright and Jennifer Dirmeyer

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Law Request: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
This message is sent on behalf of James P. Smith.

Greetings:

In order to expedite our searches and responses, and provide better customer service, requests can now be made directly through an online portal at the City of Rochester website.

The online form provides you with instant access to the City’s Records Access Application form, and guides you through the necessary steps to make a request.  With each submitted request, you will receive an email receipt letting you know that your request has been received and is being processed. This email will provide you with a reference number that you can use to track your request.  You will also be able to create an account that will auto-fill your contact information—a useful feature for frequent requestors.

Please visit www.cityofrochester.gov/FOIL<http://www.cityofrochester.gov/FOIL> to view and use the new online application form.

There is NO FEE for records and responses returned to you via email through this online request system.

Sincerely,

James P. Smith
Records Access Officer
City of Rochester
Bureau of Communications
30 Church Street, Rochester NY 14614

files.title: ~WRD000
files.source: Rochester Police Department

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
I am writing to follow up on my original request made on 8/17/17.

Thank you very much for providing the information we requested. I am writing to ask for some clarification regarding the data on officer-involved shootings. We requested the total number of annual officer involved shootings each year for the past 10 years. 

While you sent us data on officer complaints, the OIS data seems to have been overlooked. Could you please provide that data? If not, could you please clarify that your department does not collect OIS (officer involved shooting) data. 

If you are able to provide the data, please define what constitutes an officer-involved shooting in your department. For example, some departments do not count misses while others count all discharges; some include shots at animals.  Other departments include intentional and accidental shootings; others do not. Please explain to us how your department classifies the OIS included in the numbers you sent to us. 

Respectfully, -Alex Cartwright

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following New York Freedom of Information Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 17, 2017. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response, or if further clarification is needed.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: NY FOIL #RR17-02476: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Cartwright,

I do not have the answers you seek. Under the Freedom of Information Law, an agency is only required to provide copies of records, not to conduct research or answer questions. Questions may be answered only to the extent that the documents themselves may provide information relative to the subject matter of the inquiry.

If you wish to request more or different records, please visit www.cityofrochester.gov/FOIL<http://www.cityofrochester.gov/FOIL> to view and use the online application form.

If you wish to appeal the original response, you must do so in writing (please refer to request #RR17-02476) within 30 days by emailing Tim Curtin, Corporation Counsel and Appeals Officer, c/o Meghan McKenna at Meghan.mckenna@cityofrochester.gov<mailto:Meghan.mckenna@cityofrochester.gov> or by mailing your appeal to the following address:

City of Rochester
Corporation Counsel
30 Church Street, 400A
Rochester, NY 14614-1295

Sincerely,
Amalia Bellucci
Communications Aide
Bureau of Communications
30 Church Street, Room 202A
Rochester, NY 14614
585-428-6171 or 585-428-7135
585-428-8841 (fax)

files.title: ~WRD000
files.source: Rochester Police Department

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rochester, NY PD Citizen Complaints
communications.communication:
Ms. Bellucci, 

 I understand that FOIAs are designed to request specific documents. I am simply requesting documents which contain the information presented in these questions. This is how we are formatting our FOIAs for this research project since departments have many different names for their different reports. The information from you department is very important to include in our research. I humbly ask that you re-consider our request in this light. I am willing to pay for time spent collecting the reports containing this information. 

Very Respectfully, 
-Alex Cartwright

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Lewis County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Welcome to the Lewis County Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Rose  Terse, 
Thank you for registering with the Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Login: 184195-32360217@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://lewiscountywa.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
For your reference, you may access the Records Center at any time here: Public Records Center (https://lewiscountywa.gov/departments/public-records/) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P014372-033125
communications.communication:
Dear Rose  Terse, Thank you for your interest in public records of Lewis County, WA.  Your request has been received and is being processed.  Your request was received in this office on March 31, 2025 and given the reference number P014372-033125 for tracking purposes.  To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flewis-county-prosecuting-attorney-35589%252Fbrady-list-march-2025-lewis-county-prosecuting-attorney-184195%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAGs9J08vs8pO0FwruR5vh8mbqo%3A1tzCT5%3A9piGmrr1q7yFvUI6wlv22N-fCocZFytXQ4Nph0mnf8s Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.   Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Lewis County, WA

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P014372-033125
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
   
 Public Disclosure Office  
 351 NW North Street, Chehalis, WA 98532 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of March 31, 2025, Reference # P014372-033125 
Dear Rose Terse, 
Lewis County received a public records request from you on March 31, 2025. You requested the following: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flewis-county-prosecuting-attorney-35589%252Fbrady-list-march-2025-lewis-county-prosecuting-attorney-184195%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAGs9J08vs8pO0FwruR5vh8mbqo%3A1tzCT5%3A9piGmrr1q7yFvUI6wlv22N-fCocZFytXQ4Nph0mnf8s" After a diligent search, records responsive to your request have been released to the Lewis County Public Records Center. To access the records login to the Public Records Center to retrieve/download the records.  Please note that documents may be redacted pursuant to and in compliance with RCW 42.56 and other applicable statutes when produced. Per our policy, the County is waiving the fees for providing responsive records regarding this particular request since the cost would be less than one dollar.  In the future please be aware, if applicable, the fees for records will be imposed for future requests. Lewis County's Public Records Policy and fee schedule can be found on the County’s website at: http://lewiscountywa.gov/departments/public-records/
The County considers this particular request fulfilled and is now closed. The PRA’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run and the County does not intend to further address this request because of the closure. If you believe we have misunderstood your request or the scope of your request or believe additional responsive records have not been provided, please let us know as soon as possible or within 30 days as it is our intent to work with you to provide the records you are requesting. 
Thank you for your patience while we processed your request. 
Sincerely, Cherish Willis Public Records Specialist (360) 740-1299 http://lewiscountywa.gov/departments/public-records/  

If you have never used the Lewis County Public Records Center before, your email address will be your login.  You may choose the "forgot password" option to obtain a password for your use.

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tom Metzger FBI Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All files, including cross-referenced and ELSUR documents, regarding white supremacist Thomas Linton Metzger (April 9, 1938 – November 4, 2020). Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://timesofsandiego.com/life/2020/11/10/tom-metzger-dies-at-82-notorious-kkk-boss-supremacist-who-ran-for-congress/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Rosters + Photos (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

The roster of sworn police officers from 2016 - 2024
Names, badge numbers, serial numbers, division/station, sworn status.

 The department's headshot photos of all of the same officers are referenced above. Duplicates from each year do not need to be completed. At a minimum, photos for 2023 - 2024 should be included. 

Precedent: Santa Ana Police Department and LAPD have released their photos. A reminder that nothing in California Penal Code 832.7 mentions photographs in personnel records are kept confidential. Not only that, but videos and pictures of officers are regularly shared on social media. 
https://www.courthousenews.com/judge-tosses-las-second-lawsuit-against-journalist-over-police-headshots/
https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2024-11-13/city-of-la-officers-city

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Police Rosters + Photos (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Morning Mr. Scott,

You previously requested this same information in December 2024 to which we responded on January 10, 2025.

Once again in response to your request, attached please find the “Sworn Personnel Report” for a roster of sworn police officers from 2016-2024 with names, badge numbers and sworn status. With respect to your second request for the “department’s headshot photos’” the City does not possess any records responsive to this request.

Sincerely,


[Image]
Julie Koger | Lead Records Specialist
Irvine Police Department | Records
949-724-7493| 1 Civic Center Plaza, Irvine, CA 92606
jkoger@cityofirvine.org<mailto:jkoger@cityofirvine.org> | cityofirvine.org<http://cityofirvine.org/>

title: Florida Public Records Request – August 27, 2024 Arrest of Jonathan Costa After High-Speed Ferrari Pursuit

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida Public Records Request – August 27, 2024 Arrest of Jonathan Costa After High-Speed Ferrari Pursuit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of all public records related to the high-speed pursuit and arrest of Jonathan Costa on August 27, 2024, involving a stolen Ferrari Spider and law enforcement activity in both St. Johns and Flagler Counties.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from Flagler County deputies involved in the pursuit, perimeter setup, and arrest of the suspect(s) at the residence on Royal Palm Lane in Palm Coast.

All dashcam footage from patrol units engaged in the pursuit or arrest.

Any aerial surveillance footage used by Flagler County deputies or supporting agencies.

Arrest and incident reports filed by Flagler County Sheriff’s deputies

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: DOL Grant of Fee Waiver
communications.communication:
March 19, 2025 Mr. Adam  Steinbaugh 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR182855 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA  02115 Re: Freedom of Information Act Request No. # 2025-F-08970 DearAdam  Steinbaugh: Thisletter responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of March 11, 2025 in which you requested To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Adam Steinbaugh. Your request was received in our office on March 13, 2025,and assigned FOIA tracking number 2025-F-08970. Youhave requested a waiver of fees. In order to determine whetheryour request qualifies for a waiver of fees, pursuant to 29 CFR § 70.41, we must evaluate whetherdisclosure of the requested information is: not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. 
Basedon the above criteria, we have determined that you adequately addressed thestatutory requirements for a waiver of fees in your March 11, 2025, request. You have been granted a waiver of all fees associated with producing therecords requested. Please be advised, however, granting this waiver of fees does notautomatically apply to future requests. Requests for waivers of fees are determined on a case-by-case basis. Ifyou have any questions concerning my response to your request pleasecontact Viola Gonzales, Government Information Specialist at 936-270-1330. In addition, itwould be helpful to include the tracking number in any submission or to have itavailable at the time of a call. Sincerely, AgencyDisclosure Officer

communications.subject: FOIA 2025-F-08977/Expedited Processing FOIA
communications.communication:
This is in response to your Freedomof Information request received in our office on 13/13/25 requesting the abovementioned records.  These records are nowavailable and have been enclosed for your information. You will note some informationhas been removed from the documents. This is authorized under the rules and regulations, includingexemptions, contained in the Freedom of Information Act and 29 CFR Part 70.  For specific numbers and wording ofexemptions, please refer to Attachment #1. You have the right to appeal this decision with theSolicitor of Labor within 90 days from the date of this letter.  Theappeal must state, in writing, the grounds for the appeal, including anysupporting statements or arguments.  The appeal should also include a copyof your initial request and a copy of this letter. If you appeal, you may mail your appeal to: Solicitor ofLabor, U.S. Department of Labor, Room N-2420, 200 Constitution Avenue, N.W.,Washington, D.C. 20210 or fax your appeal to (202) 693-5538. Alternatively, you may email your appeal to foiaappeal@dol.gov;appeals submitted to any other email address will not be accepted.  Theenvelope (if mailed), subject line (if emailed), or fax cover sheet (if faxed),and the letter indicating the grounds for appeal, should be clearly marked:“Freedom of Information Act Appeal.” (mailto:foiaappeal@dol.gov) Inaddition to filing an appeal, you may contact the Department’s FOIA PublicLiaison, Ramona Oliver at (202) 731-5491or oliver.ramona@dol.gov (mailto:oliver.ramona@dol.gov) for assistance inresolving disputes You also may contact the Office of Government InformationServices (OGIS) for assistance.  OGIS offers mediation services to resolvedisputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusivealternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your rightto pursue litigation.  You may mail OGIS at the Office of GovernmentInformation Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601Adelphi Road – OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001. Alternatively, you may email or contact OGIS through itswebsite at: ogis@nara.gov (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) ; Web: https://ogis.archives.gov (https://ogis.archives.gov/) .  Finally,you can call or fax OGIS at: telephone: (202) 741-5770; toll-free:1-877-684-6448. It is also important to note that the services offered byOGIS, is not an alternative to filing an administrative FOIA appeal. If we can be of further assistance to you, please feel freeto contact this office at 516-334-3344 or email skoch.joanna@dol.gov (mailto:skoch.joanna@dol.gov) 
Enclosure ATTACHMENT #1 Most used exemptions paragraphs from 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b): #4                  Information that is classifiedas trade secrets and/or of commercial or financial value obtained from a personand is privileged or a confidential source of information. #5                  Inter-agency or intra-agencymemorandums or letters which would not be available by law to a party otherthan an agency in litigation with the Agency. #6                  This exclusion is intended toexclude from disclosure all personal and medical files, and all private orpersonal information contained in other files which, if disclosed to thepublic, would amount to a clearly unwarranted invasion of the privacy of anyperson, including members of the family of the person to whom the informationpertains. #7                  Information contained ininvestigatory files complied for law enforcement purposes except to the extentavailable by law to a party other than an agency. #7(C)            Information pertaining to theprivacy interests of individuals, including                        information about anindividual which he could reasonably assert an option to withhold from thepublic at large because of its intimacy or its possible adverse effect uponhimself or his family. #7(D)            The identification of a confidentialsource or confidential information furnished by a confidential source.

communications.subject: Re: ORR2024_593 [EXTERNAL] Georgia Open Records Act Request: GORA Request: ORR2024573
communications.communication:
Hello,

A preliminary search of our email server has been conducted and the Department of Atlanta Information Management (AIM) has identified approximately 217 emails potentially responsive to the search parameters you provided.  Prior to release, each email must be reviewed to determine whether it is responsive and to ensure that it does not include any information which is exempt from production in accordance with the Georgia Open Records Act, including but not limited to that which is exempt from production under the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine (OCGA Secs. 50-18-72(a)(41) and (a)(42)).  This review is estimated to take approximately 0.72 hours at a rate of 300 emails reviewed per hour. 
 
Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act
 
the charge for the search, retrieval, or redaction of records shall not exceed the prorated hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee who, in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the request.
 
OCGA Sec. 50-18-71(b)(1)(A)
 
The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department Of Atlanta Information Management (AIM), who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search retrieval and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine is $19.60. per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee  0.47 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.
 
The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department of Law, who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the emails is $39.81 per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee 0.23 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.
 
Accordingly, we estimate that the cost to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the records which you have requested to be $18.36 .

Please respond at your earliest convenience to indicate your willingness to incur the above-estimated costs.  Alternatively, you may wish to modify the search parameters of your request by narrowing the time frame for the search, or providing keywords.
Best,

Victoria Savage
AIM Administrative Assistant

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GORA Request: ORR2024573
communications.communication:
Hello,

A preliminary search of our email server has been conducted and the Department of Atlanta Information Management (AIM) has identified approximately 217 emails potentially responsive to the search parameters you provided.  Prior to release, each email must be reviewed to determine whether it is responsive and to ensure that it does not include any information which is exempt from production in accordance with the Georgia Open Records Act, including but not limited to that which is exempt from production under the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine (OCGA Secs. 50-18-72(a)(41) and (a)(42)).  This review is estimated to take approximately 0.72 hours at a rate of 300 emails reviewed per hour. 
 
Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act
 
the charge for the search, retrieval, or redaction of records shall not exceed the prorated hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee who, in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the request.
 
OCGA Sec. 50-18-71(b)(1)(A)
 
The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department Of Atlanta Information Management (AIM), who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search retrieval and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine is $19.60. per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee  0.47 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.
 
The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department of Law, who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the emails is $39.81 per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee 0.23 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.
 
Accordingly, we estimate that the cost to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the records which you have requested to be $18.36 .

Please respond at your earliest convenience to indicate your willingness to incur the above-estimated costs. Alternatively, you may wish to modify the search parameters of your request by narrowing the time frame for the search, or providing keywords.
Best,



Victoria Savage
AIM Administrative Assistant

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GORA Request: ORR2024573
communications.communication:
Yes, I can pay $18.36. If the charge increases, please confirm with me.

Thanks.

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #ORR2025_103
communications.communication:
Hello,
After further review and consultation with the City’s Chief Transparency Officer, it appears the issue was related to OneDrive. The initial search returned 77 hits; however, many of these were duplicates. Since OneDrive does not allow duplicate files in a folder, the attachments provided consist of those duplicates that could not be uploaded.
To ensure you have access to all 77 emails, I have created a new OneDrive folder and provided the link below. Please note that between the attachments and the emails in the OneDrive folder, you should have the complete set of requested records.
OneDrive Link: [https://res-1.cdn.office.net/assets/mail/file-icon/png/folder_16x16.png] ORR_103 Pt 2<https://cityofatlanta-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/vsavage_atlantaga_gov/EoCreJbP1YJLr9BXnWD_EYsBDqpVH_dg8KMLPKyGHmEALg?e=DSjXhX>
As a reminder, the OneDrive link will only be active for 30 days. If you wish to retain any emails, please download and save them before the link expires.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Best regards,

Victoria Savage
AIM Administrative Assistant

title: Kevin Riford's e-mail to NYS Governor Kathy Hochul & Lt. Governor Delgado

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Kevin Riford's e-mail to NYS Governor Kathy Hochul & Lt. Governor Delgado
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Copy of any and all emails received by Governor.Hochul@exec.ny.gov and lgny@exec.ny.gov FROM the following e-mail: kevinriford@outlook.com on January 8, 2025. I've attached photos for reference.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

New York State Executive Chamber Records Access Office

title: Public Records Request – March 23, 2025 Fatal DWI Crash on I-20 (Cesar Ramirez Castro & Co.)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Records Request – March 23, 2025 Fatal DWI Crash on I-20 (Cesar Ramirez Castro & Co.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the March 23, 2025, fatal DWI crash that occurred on eastbound I-20 near Bowen Road in Arlington, Texas, in which a 22-year-old man was killed. The Arlington Police Department responded to the crash around 7:35 p.m., which involved a pickup truck and a passenger car. The crash resulted in a fire that fully engulfed the car and led to the death of the driver.

Three individuals were arrested in connection with this crash:

Cesar Ramirez Castro (driver of the pickup, charged with intoxication manslaughter and collision involving death)

Marcelino Ramirez-Ramirez

Castro Zammarron

I am requesting the following:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers on scene

Dashcam footage (including any unit on-scene or en route)

911 call audio and dispatch records

Arrest reports, incident reports, and affidavits

Any mugshots and booking documentation

Supplemental reports and diagrams related to crash scene investigation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

communications.communication:
Dear Christopher  Udeani, 
Welcome to the Arlington Police Open Records Request Center. We have received your request no R197312-032725 on 3/27/2025 11:33:09 PM. You have asked for: 
 
Description: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the March 23, 2025, fatal DWI crash that occurred on eastbound I-20 near Bowen Road in Arlington, Texas, in which a 22-year-old man was killed. The Arlington Police Department responded to the crash around 7:35 p.m., which involved a pickup truck and a passenger car. The crash resulted in a fire that fully engulfed the car and led to the death of the driver.

Three individuals were arrested in connection with this crash:

Cesar Ramirez Castro (driver of the pickup, charged with intoxication manslaughter and collision involving death)

Marcelino Ramirez-Ramirez

Castro Zammarron

I am requesting the following:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers on scene

Dashcam footage (including any unit on-scene or en route)

911 call audio and dispatch records

Arrest reports, incident reports, and affidavits

Any mugshots and booking documentation

Supplemental reports and diagrams related to crash scene investigation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpolice-333%252Fpublic-records-request-march-23-2025-fatal-dwi-crash-on-i-20-cesar-ramirez-castro-co-184029%252F%253Femail%253Darlingtontx%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAdlWyFFAAAhZBzFKKjYYWzbrA%3A1ty1NY%3AC7EyoLIHvPQ8cU-gurRzyk7RIPtOfzByYYLX_s75EBg 
The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The governmental body will try to complete the request as soon as possible with notification if the request will require more than 10 business days to complete. The governmental body may collect a fee as prescribed by law or regulation for the requested documents. If a fee is not prescribed by law or regulation, the fee shall be the actual cost of duplicating the record(s). 
You can monitor the progress of this issue at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Arlington Police Open Records Center. 
Sincerely, 
Arlington Police Department

RE: Public Records Request for Police Records 

Dear Christopher  Udeani, 
We have received your open records request . 
The records responsive to this request involve a pending matter. Pursuant to Section 552.108 of the Government Code, we are not able to release them at this time. 
When you completed your open records request you agreed to all exclusions, which includes withholding pending information. Based on your agreement, the Arlington Police Department - Legal Division is not sending this matter to the Attorney General for a ruling and withholding the records. 
For your convenience, please find attached, the Basic Information Report associated with the records that are pending.   Once the case has been closed, more information may be available for release. Please submit a new Police Open Records Request at that time. 
Please contact the records department at (817)459-5683 with any questions. 
Sincerely, 
Records Services 
City of Arlington TX Police

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Aaron Kamalu - Signal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding Officer Aaron Kamalu #5990, I am requesting:

1. For every conversation in the officer’s Signal app, including archived and deleted conversations, please provide:
1a. The title, avatar, description, and retention period set for the chat.
1b. A listing of all members in the chat.
1c. All messages, images, and files sent and received in the chat, sufficient to discern sender’s name and avatar, time received, and message content, as well as events including but not limited to entering and leaving chat, changing retention time, etc.

2. The list of all contacts in the officer’s Signal app. This can be found by clicking the “New Message” icon.

3. The name, avatar, and username set for the officer themself. This can be found by clicking the profile icon.

If copying these messages by hand is burdensome, I understand that SPD owns software tools that can be used to extract these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

RE: Public Disclosure Request#: P174442-031224 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
This acknowledges receipt of your public disclosure request P174442-031224 received on March 12, 2024. 
We interpret your request as follows: 
*** Signal App Items for Officer Aaron Kamalu: All chats, avatars, titles, message contents, and descriptions for chat. Contacts in the app. Name/username, avatar for the officer inside the app.*** 
If we do not hear from you within 5 business days, we will assume that our interpretation is correct. At this time, the City will provide you with a first installment of records on 08/22/2024. However, please note that this time estimate may change based on any clarification you provide and as we continue to process your request. 
*** I also received an email from you regarding PDR P174441, I did respond inside of that PDR,- I spoke directly to Detective Agate and he confirmed that the app was installed on his phone. However, he indicated that he did not create a profile and never logged in. To ensure appropriate documented contact, please only message within the govqa program and not email. ***

Justin Jackson 
Seattle Police Department 
Legal Unit

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P174442-031224
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P174442-031224. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P174442-031224. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-P174442-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net)

As a reminder you can login at the Police Records Request Center where you can access Police online information, manage your profile, submit record requests, track your request status, receive and send messages, make payments, view frequently asked questions, and download your records.
